intro: Lysimachia barystachys var. quelpaertensis, commonly known as the Jeju yellow flower, is a flowering plant native to the Korean Peninsula. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. It has heart-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
